title.narrative: Workshop Series - United States-Southeast Asia Aviation Cooperation Program Workshop Series Phase II, through Futron Corporation

description.narrative: USTDA funding would support a series of four (4) workshops to provide a broad range of managerial, technical, safety, efficiency, capacity, and operational training to key officials from civil aviation authorities, airlines, air navigation providers, and/or individual airport operators in Southeast Asia and Pacific Islands. The U.S.-Southeast Asia Aviation Cooperation Program Workshops Series Phase II would serve as a forum where representatives from U.S. industry and government engage Southeast Asian and Pacific Island counterparts to collaborate on best practices, standards, and policy development for the regions aviation industry.

title.narrative: Technical Symposium - 2024 Indo-Pacific Business Forum Technical Symposium, through The Webster Group

description.narrative: This contract funds the 2024 Indo Pacific Business Forum, which brings together senior U.S. and regional government officials with business officials to advance the objectives of the Indo-Pacific vision. The Forum would be held as a hybrid event, with a 500 in-person element held in Manila, Philippines and an anticipated 1,500-person online audience. The event will include representatives from across the Indo-Pacific.

title.narrative: Indo-Pacific Economic Framework Digital Customs and Trade Facilitation Reverse Trade Mission Series, through National US Arab Chamber Of Commerce (Inc)

description.narrative: This USTDA-funded reverse trade mission (RTM) series will bring customs officials from Indo-Pacific Economic Framework for Prosperity (IPEF) member countries - Fiji, India, Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Thailand, and Vietnam - to the United States to familiarize them with state-of-the-art U.S. technologies, services, and best practices to digitalize and secure customs processes and procedures essential to facilitating international trade. The RTMs would build awareness of U.S. technologies, solutions, and best practices that can support safe, secure, and efficient supply chains and would connect U.S. firms to customs agencies in IPEF member countries to support opportunities for future business partnerships. The RTM series will focus on cargo scanning technologies and digital solutions, including artificial intelligence, blockchain, and data analytics, that can improve customs efficiency and risk management.

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Asia-Pacific Flight Standards, through Koeppen, Elliot & Associates, Ltd.

description.narrative: The Asia-Pacific Flight Standards Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) provided an opportunity for delegations from Southeast Asia to travel to the United States to learn about regulatory best practices to improve civil aviation safety and security oversight in their countries. The RTM aimed to help the civil aviation authorities (CAAs) bring flight standards into conformance with International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) guidelines and assist the countries in their pursuit to obtain Category One (Cat I) status under the Federal Aviation Administrations (FAA) International Aviation Safety Assessment Program (IASA). Improving civil aviation safety and security oversight in Southeast Asia and helping the CAAs obtain Cat I status would enable national flag air carriers to provide direct service to the United States.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Waste to Energy / Biomass, through Meridian International Center

description.narrative: This reverse trade mission (RTM) introduced officials and project owners in the waste-to-energy (WTE) and biomass sector from Indonesia, the Philippines, and Thailand to the spectrum of industry suppliers, service providers, and sector regulators in the United States. The delegation consisted of both public and private sector representatives pursuing investments in the WTE and biomass arena. As this was a regional activity, it supported the work that USTDA is undertaking as part of the U.S.-Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) Connectivity Cooperation Initiative as well as the U.S.-Asia Comprehensive Energy Partnership.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Energy generation, renewable sources - multiple technologies

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - APEC Business Aviation Access, through American Association of Airport Executives

description.narrative: The Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) Business Aviation Access Workshop and Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) promoted dialogue to create compatible and more favorable regulatory and development environments for the expansion of business and general aviation operations in key Asia-Pacific markets. The workshop and RTM focused on linking APEC aviation regulators with U.S. counterparts, operators, and manufacturers of general aviation technologies and equipment.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - ASEAN Connectivity through Rail Forum, through TERA International Group, Inc.

description.narrative: This technical symposium promoted the best practices and use of U.S. rail and transportation technologies in Southeast Asian countries. The forum focused on matching Southeast Asian project sponsors in the rail sector with U.S. providers of rail technologies and transportation services.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - ASEAN Disaster Management, Mitigation, and Response Technologies Workshop, through Business Council for International Understanding

description.narrative: This technical symposium promoted the best practices and use of U.S. disaster management, response, and mitigation technologies in Southeast Asian countries. The workshop focused on matching Southeast Asian project sponsors in the disaster management sector with U.S. providers of information and communications technology (ICT) solutions and services. The workshop also provided a venue for governments and relevant industries to have dialogue on advancing operational procedures, guidance for disaster and emergency management, and training services.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Symposium - CLEAN ENERGY TRADE AND INVESTMENT CONFERENCE, through Business Council for International Understanding

description.narrative: USTDA funding of $406,800 supports a two and a half-day workshop that discusses strategies to increase natural gas utilization in the developing economies of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) forum. It addresses issues related to the pursuit of clean energy development in the region which includes renewable energy and the adoption of policies and technologies that enhance power production with a focus on pollution reduction.

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - ASIA-PACIFIC COMMERCIAL AVIATION ACCESS, through MFM Lamey Group, LLC

description.narrative: This $366,808 orientation visit hosts delegates from the Asia-Pacific region in the San Francisco and Seattle areas and includes government-to-government related meetings with the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration and Transportation Security Administration. Additionally the visit includes meetings with the private sector to better understand U.S. safety requirements associated with gaining access to the U.S. aviation market.

title.narrative: Technical Symposium - ASEAN DISASTER MANAGEMENT, MITIGATION, AND RESPONSE TECHNOLOGIES WORKSHOP, through Business Council for International Understanding

description.narrative: This $298,538 Technical Symposium promotes the best practices and use of U.S. disaster management, response and mitigation technologies in Southeast Asian countries. The workshop focuses on matching Southeast Asian project sponsors in the disaster management sector with U.S. providers of information and communications technology (ICT) solutions and services. The workshop also provides a venue for governments and relevant industries to have dialogue on advancing operational procedures, guidance for disaster and emergency management and training services.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - APEC BUSINESS AVIATION ACCESS, through American Association of Airport Executives

description.narrative: This $442,721 APEC Business Aviation Access Workshop and Reverse Trade Mission promotes dialogue to create compatible and more favorable regulatory and development environments for the expansion of business and general aviation operations in key Asia-Pacific markets. The workshop and RTM focus on linking APEC aviation regulators with U.S. counterparts, operators, and manufactures of general aviation technologies and equipment.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - ASEAN SMART GRID AND POWER TRANSMISSION WORKSHOP AND RTM, through MFM Lamey Group, LLC

description.narrative: This $419,537 ASEAN Connectivity: Smart Grid Workshop and Reverse Trade Mission promotes the interconnectivity of transmission systems and best technologies and practices for transmission and distribution in Southeast Asian countries. The workshop and RTM focus on connecting Southeast Asia project sponsors in the power generation and transmission sector with U.S. providers of advanced smart grid and transmission systems and services. The workshop also provides a venue for governments and relevant industries to have dialogue on technological tools for promoting energy efficiency and improving power transmission systems in the region.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Definitional Mission - THE PHILIPPINES AND INDONESIA CLEAN ENERGY PROJECTS, through Constant Group, LLC

description.narrative: This definitional mission (DM) to the Indonesia and Philippines identifies and evaluates at least two projects in the clean energy and power sector in each country for USTDA funding consideration. The DM contractor focuses on the evaluation of proposed and potential projects, including the development of new power plants, capacity expansion of existing power plants, and improvements of IT infrastructure for monitoring power generation and transmission.
